amendment.description: Amendment clarifies that early childhood developmental screenings can be considered an allowable medical service for donation to children in the care of the Office of Refugee Resettlement.
amendment.purpose: An amendment numbered 60 printed in Part A of House Report 116-109 to clarify that early childhood developmental screenings can be considered an allowable medical service for donation to children in the care of the Office of Refugee Resettlement.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Schrier amendment (A057) Agreed to by recorded vote: 371 - 49 (Roll no. 306).

action.text: Amendment agreed to Committee of the Whole
Roll call votes on amendments in House
House amendment agreed to: On agreeing to the Schrier amendment (A057) Agreed to by recorded vote: 371 - 49 (Roll no. 306).
House amendment offered/reported by: Amendment (A057) offered by Ms. Schrier.
